oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Discharge of William H. Bendy, Co. M, 9th N.J. Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bendy's regiment was the first from his state to see combat at Roanoke Island, North Carolina in February 1862. He received a furlough and was able to return home briefly due to his reenlistment in January 1864. the regiment spent most of the war on the North Carolina coast. They were sent to Virginia were they served from April to August 1864 having fought at Bermuda Hundred, Drewry's Bluff, Cold Harbor and Petersburg. They retunred to North Carolina and mustered out in July 1865.
